Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Nicotinamide Riboside in Cardiac Ischemia-Reperfusion Injury

Trial_Design.evidence: Mice were randomised to receive either NR (50 mg/L) or vehicle control.

Participants.evidence: This randomised controlled trial involved C57BL6/N adult male mice.

Intervention.evidence: Mice were randomised to receive either NR (50 mg/L) or vehicle control.

Objective.evidence: This study investigates NR's efficacy in protecting isolated mouse hearts from ischemia-reperfusion (IR) injury.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was infarct size, measured by TTC staining after 90 minutes of reperfusion.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was maintained for outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 16 mice were randomised, with 8 in each group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: NR treatment significantly reduced infarct size compared to control (mean difference = 15%, 95% CI 10% to 20%; p < 0.01).

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group.
